page.title: 11The Country Park
page.content: The{Country Park}which surrounds {Holme Pierrepont Watersports Centre}is a very important amenity for local people. Except during times when a competition is being held, admission is free. There is a large area where people can walk and picnic. Special small artificial lakes are used for fishing and are kept well-stocked with many different fish. A variety of wild-life lives in the Park which makes a walk there a very interesting and enjoyable experience. There is also a good collection of wild flowers and trees through which to walk. Recently a{Caravan and Camping Park has been opened near to the Centre. It covers an area of 18 acres. A road winds through it so that 300 caravans can be parked in their own little areas among trees and shrubs.
